channel.title: Starting a Business on
channel.description: Recent content in Starting a Business on

item.description: If you are a single-person business (sole proprietor or single-member LLC), you don’t have to have an EIN (Employer Identification Number) or business bank account.
Happy and Effective Community Discord private to workshop attendees If you can see this private site, you can join the private Discord!
For the first two years I would bill clients as a sole proprietor, and money goes directly to my personal bank account.

item.title: Defining Your Services
item.description: After you define your services, you’ll likely need: Pricing Your Services Your first year you might “try on” a lot of services – learning which things there is “market appetite” for, and which things you like to do.

item.title: Formal Paperwork
item.description: Do we need formal paperwork? I usually (80% of the time) get clients to sign a contract (MSA/SOW) with rates and all.

item.title: Getting Clients
item.description: For someone to buy your service, they go through phases flowchart LR Aware -- Interested -- Desire -- Action AIDA

item.title: Legal Structures and Taxes
item.description: My favorite place to learn more about these is the YouTube channel “All Up In Yo’ Business with Attorney Aiden Durham”

item.title: Pricing Your Services
item.description: pricing per hour vs value-based you can do per-hour to get started The most common advice lately is to focus on value-based pricing â€” how much is the customer willing to pay to get the benefit?

item.title: Tools
item.description: Notion, Quickbooks, Google Business, Stripe Invoicing, Stripe Atlas, Mercury Bank, Obsidian, Reclaim.ai, Calendly, Mailtrack.io, Whereby, Teachable, Gumroad, Etsy, Printful, Namecheap, super.
